om.graph
Class AxisItemBase

java.lang.Object
  om.graph.GraphItem
      om.graph.AxisItemBase
Direct Known Subclasses:
XAxisItem, YAxisItem
public abstract class AxisItemBase
extends GraphItem

Base class for standard X and Y axes. Contains all properties that are shared between the two axes (i.e. most of them).

See property descriptions for details, but axis features are:

  • A simple axis line with any range (start and end) and other co-ordinate (X position for Y axis, Y position for X). Colour can be altered.
  • Optional major and optional minor tickmarks at any frequency. These can optionally be omitted within a given range of the axis. Their size and colour can be altered along with their position (on the + or - side or both sides of the axis).
  • Optional numbering at any frequency. This can optionally be omitted within a given range of the axis. Font and colour can be altered. The margin between the axis (or any protruding tickmarks) and numbers can be altered. Numbers may be rotated 90 degrees in either direction, or left horizontal.
  • An optional text label. Font and colour can be altered. The label is always rotated for Y axis and left alone for X axis, but its direction of rotation can be changed.

paintAxisText

protected abstract int paintAxisText(java.awt.Graphics2D g2,
                                     double dPoint,
                                     java.lang.String sText,
                                     boolean bRotate,
                                     boolean bFlip,
                                     boolean bNumbers,
                                     int iExtraOffset)
Paints some text. Use current font/colour in context.

Parameters:
g2 - Target graphics context
dPoint - Position
sText - Number as string
bRotate - Whether to rotate the number in line with axis
bFlip - Whether to rotate it the other direction from normal
iExtraOffset - Space from axis to use
bNumbers - If true, assumes text is numbers (for spacing)
Returns:
Space from axis used (including offset) to paint this text

Sets the tick spacing.

Parameters:
sTicks - Tick specification: "1.0" = major ticks every 1, "1.0,0.5" = major ticks and minor ticks. "" or "0.0" = no ticks

setTickSide

public void setTickSide(java.lang.String s)
                 throws GraphFormatException
Sets the side of the axis that ticks go on.

Parameters:
s - In code, use an AXISSIDE_x constant; in XML, "+" is positive side (default), "-" is negative side, "both" is both sides.
Throws:
GraphFormatException

setRotateNumbers

public void setRotateNumbers(boolean b)
Sets rotation for numbers.

Parameters:
b - If true, numbers are rotated in line with axis (but see setRotateFlip)

setRotateFlip

public void setRotateFlip(boolean b)
Chooses alternate rotation direction for numbers (and labels, on Y axis)

Parameters:
b - If true, numbers are rotated the other way around
